definition: to occupy the same place in space or time
examples: The base of the triangle coincides with one side of the square.
The heroic age of bridge construction coincided with the expansion of the railroads …

definition: to occupy exactly corresponding or equivalent positions on a scale or in a series
to correspond in nature, character, or function
examples: " … our sentiments coincided in every particular … "

definition: to be in accord or agreement : concur
examples: She coincided with his views on most subjects.
